title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: View website !

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: bpartymarce244 R package designed help : 1. Simulate ice cream parties calculating volume surface area cones. 2. Visualize weather forecasts simulate party needs based weather conditions. 3. Use interactive Shiny app explore weather data plan resources multiple locations. package developed part programming tools assignment, combining R programming, Shiny apps, weather forecasting.

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: Define cone’s radius based height. Calculate volume surface area cones. Simulate variations cone shapes account realistic scenarios. Retrieve 5-day weather forecasts cities using OpenWeatherMap API. Use weather data (temperature, humidity, pressure) simulate guest behavior estimate resource needs. Visualize weather trends across multiple cities. Simulate ice cream party needs (cone volume surface area) 3 cities.

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: install bpartymarce244 package, clone repository install locally: ```bash git clone https://github.com/ptds2024/bpartymarce244.git

title: Volume Summary — volume_summary
code: sim_results_df <- data.frame(volume = runif(100, 300, 1000), surface = runif(100, 50, 150)) volume_summary(sim_results_df) #> $volume_99 #>      99%  #> 997.4479  #>  #> $surface_99 #>      99%  #> 149.6919  #>  #> $mean_volume #> [1] 655.1581 #>  #> $mean_surface #> [1] 103.9404 #>  #> $sd_volume #> [1] 191.935 #>  #> $sd_surface #> [1] 31.09419 #>
